choose-country.title: Localization
choose-country.subtitle: Please choose the country you are in right now or the country for which you wish to view resources.

choose-language.title: Language
choose-language.subtitle: Please choose the language of the app content.

learn.title: Learn
learn.description: Learn more information about PTSD - for you or for someone you care about.

monitor-progress.title: Monitor Progress
monitor-progress.description: Monitor your progress over time and get feedback.

manage-symptoms.title: Manage Symptoms
manage-symptoms.description: Choose your favourite instruments for managing stress.

get-support.title: Get Support
get-support.description: Connect with support and resources that can truly help you.

welcome.title: Welcome to PTSD Help
welcome.description: This app is designed to support trauma survivors. Please note that it cannot provide medical diagnosis or treatment - these services can only be provided by healthcare professionals. But it can help you learn more about PTSD and manage your symptoms, by providing you with the necessary tools and information for managing the distress that trauma can cause.

personalize.title: Personalize the app by adding:
personalize.l1: Contact information for friends, family or your support network
personalize.l2: Soothing photos of nature or places that are important to you
personalize.modify_preferences: You can always modify your preferences later from the settings menu.

dashboard.evaluate: Evaluate the intensity of your PTSD symptoms by answering 20 simple questions.

distress-meter.title: What's your current level of distress?
distress-meter.scale: {{min}} means no distress, {{max}} is the worst
distress-meter.subtitle: Tap on the up and down arrows to indicate how you are feeling.

high-distress.text: This is a very high level of distress. It would be good to get help as soon as possible. Would you like to talk to someone now?

actions.help: No, continue to the support tool
actions.talk: Yes, I want to talk to someone

relationships.helper: Try these strategies - either on your own or, better, with your partner!
